name: dco
description: Cladding outer diameter.

name: thkcld
description: Cladding wall thickness.

name: thkgap
description: Pellet-cladding as-fabricated radial gap thickness.

name: totl
description: The total (active) fuel column length.

name: cpl
description: Cold plenum length.

name: dspg
description: Outer diameter of plenum spring.
limitations: Required Input (dgpg? should be less than the clad inner diameter)

name: dspgw
description: Diameter of the plenum spring wire.

name: vs
description: Number of turns in the plenum spring.

name: hplt
description: Height (length) of each pellet.

name: rc
description: The inner pellet radius.

name: hdish
description: Height (depth) of pellet dish, assumed to be a spherical indentation.

name: dishsd
description: Pellet end-dish shoulder width (outer radius of fuel pellet minus radius of dish).

name: enrch
description: Fuel pellet U-235 enrichment.

name: imox
description: Index for modeling MOX: 0 = UO₂ fuel, >0 = mixed oxide fuel, 1 = use Duriez/Ronchi/NFI Mod thermal conductivity correlation, 2  = use Halden thermal conductivity correlation (if imox>0, must include comp and namelist $FRPMOX)

name: comp
description: Weight percent of plutonia in fuel (used if imox > 0).

name: moxtype
description: Type of Pu used in MOX. moxtype = 1 reactor grade, moxtype = 2 weapons grade

name: enrpu39
description: Fuel pellet Pu-239 content

name: enrpu40
description: Fuel pellet Pu-240 content

name: enrpu41
description: Fuel pellet Pu-241 content

name: enrpu42
description: Fuel pellet Pu-242 content

name: fotmtl
description: Oxygen-to-metal atomic ratio in the oxide fuel pellet.
limitations: If MOX fuel is selected, fotmtl should be less than 2.0. Default = 2.0

name: gadoln
description: Weight fraction of gadolinia in urania-gadolinia fuel pellets.

name: ifba
description: Percent of IFBA rods in the core.
limitations: Valid only between 10 and 50 percent. Default = 0.0

name: b10
description: Boron-10 enrichment in ZrB₂.

name: zrb2thick
description: ZrB₂ layer thickness on pellets.

name: zrb2den
description: Percent theoretical density of ZrB₂ (TD = 6.08 g/cm³).

name: ppmh2o
description: Parts per million by weight of moisture in the as-fabricated pellets.

name: ppmn2
description: Parts per million by weight of nitrogen in the as-fabricated pellets.

name: den
description: As-fabricated apparent fuel density.
limitations: Theoretical density taken as 10.96 g/cm³. Required Input

name: deng
description: Open porosity fraction for pellets.

name: roughf
description: The fuel pellet surface arithmetic mean roughness, peak-to-average.

name: rsntr
description: The increase in pellet density expected during in-reactor operation (determined from a standard re-sintering test per NUREG-0085 and Regulatory Guide 1.126)

name: tsint
description: Temperature at which pellets were sintered.

name: icm
description: Cladding Type Indicator: 2 = Zircaloy-2, 4 = Zircaloy-4, 5 = M5, 6 = ZIRLO™.

name: zr2vintage
description: Flag to select Zircaloy-2 vintage: 0 = older (pre-1998), 1 = newer (post-1998).

name: cldwks
description: Cold-work of the cladding (fractional reduction in cross-section area due to processing). PNNL recommends 0.5 for stress relief annealed cladding and 0.0 for fully recrystallized cladding.

name: roughc
description: Cladding surface arithmetic mean roughness, peak-to-average.

name: catexf
description: Cladding texture factor; defined as the fraction of cladding cells with basal poles parallel to the longitudinal axis of the cladding tube.

name: chorg
description: As-fabricated hydrogen in cladding.

name: fgpav
description: Initial fill gas pressure (taken to be at room temperature).

name: idxgas
description: Initial fill gas type indicator: 1 = helium, 2 = air, 3 = nitrogen, 4 = fission gas, 5 = argon, 6 = user-specified mix (using the amfxx variables amfair, etc.)

name: amfair
description: Mole fraction of air; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amfarg
description: Mole fraction of argon; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amffg
description: Mole fraction of fission gas; use only if idxgas = 6 and amfxe and amfkry = 0.0.

name: amfhe
description: Mole fraction of helium; use only if idxgas = 6.
limitations: Default = 0.0 (note default on idxgas = 1 initializes pure He)

name: amfh2
description: Mole fraction of hydrogen; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amfh2o
description: Mole fraction of water vapor; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amfkry
description: Mole fraction of krypton; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amfn2
description: Mole fraction of nitrogen; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: amfxe
description: Mole fraction of xenon; use only if idxgas = 6.

name: iplant
description: Signal for which type of reactor: -2 = PWR, -3 = BWR, -4 = HBWR.

name: nsp
description: Signal for time-dependent input arrays for p2, tw, and go. If nsp = 0, single values for these three variables will be used for all time steps. If nsp = 1, a value for each variable for each time step must be input.

name: p2
description: Coolant system pressure. Must be input for each time step if nsp = 1. Defined as p2(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: tw
description: Coolant inlet temperature. Enter a value for every time step if nsp = 1. Defined as tw(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: go
description: Mass flux of coolant around fuel rod.  Input a value for each time step if nsp = 1.  Note that go input may have to be adjusted to yield both desired coolant and desired cladding surface temperatures. Concurrent adjustment of pitch may also be required. Defined as go(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: pitch
description: Center-to-center distance between rods in a square array.
limitations: Must be greater than dco. Required Input

name: icor
description: Index for Crud Model: icor = 0 or 1 yields constant crud thickness; 0.0 mil crud as default; input crdt as constant thickness. Maximum temperature rise permitted across this layer is 20 °F. icor = 2 yields time-dependent crud; growth rate is crdtr, starting from zero crud layer. There is no limit to the temperature rise across the crud when icor=2. The conductivity of the layer is 0.5 Btu/hr/ft-°F.

name: crdt
description: Initial thickness of crud layer on cladding outside surface.

name: crdtr
description: Rate of crud accumulation (used if icor = 2).

name: crudmult
description: Axial array of multipliers on crud thickness or crud growth rate. Defined as crudmult(J-1), where J = 1 + N = 1 + Axial Node Index

name: flux
description: Conversion between fuel specific power (W/g) and fast neutron flux (n/m²/s, E>1MeV). Defined as flux(J), where J = 1 + N = 1 + Axial Node Index

name: im
description: Number of time steps.
limitations: Greater than 1, less than 400. Required Input

name: ProblemTime
description: Cumulative time at the end of each time step.  Note: Time steps greater than 50 days are not recommended. If steady-state operation is being modeled, use time steps greater than 1 day.  Time steps less than 1 day should only be used when modeling a fast power ramp. Defined as ProblemTime(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: qmpy
description: The linear heat generation rate at each time step.  This equals the rod-average value if iq = 0 and the peak value if iq = 1. Note: Changes in local LHGR of greater than 1.5 kw/ft per time step are not recommended. Size qmpy accordingly. Defined as qmpy(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: iq
description: Indicator for axial power shape: 0 = User-input power shapes, with qmpy = rod-average powers and power shapes defined by qf,x, and fa = 1.0. 1 = Chopped-cosine shape, with fa = Peak-to-average ratio and qmpy = peak power (use na=odd in order to have an axial node corresponding to the input peak power).

name: x
description: Elevations in each qf,x array defining a power shape. Note the first value should be 0.0, and last value must = totl. Defined as x(N), where N = Axial Node Index for Input Power Profile.
limitations: Required Input if iq = 0. Maximum number of qf,x pairs is 40.

name: qf
description: The ratio of the linear power at the x(N) elevation to the axiallyaveraged value for the M-th power shape. The number of QF, X pairs for the Mth power shape is defined by jn(M).  The code will automatically normalize to an average value of 1.0. Defined as qf(N), where N = Axial Node Index for Input Power Profile , M = Power Shape Number.
limitations: Required Input if iq = 0 Maximum number of qf, x pairs is 40.

name: jn
description: The number of qf, x value pairs for each axial power shape; required input if iq = 0.  Input in the same sequence as the qf and x arrays. Defined as jn(M), where M = Power Shape Number.
limitations: Required Input if iq=0. Maximum number of shapes is 20. Maximum number of qf, x pairs is 40.

name: jst
description: The sequential number of the power shape to be used for each time step. One value of jst is required per time step if iq = 0. Defined as jst(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.
limitations: Required Input if iq=0. Maximum number of power shapes is 20. Maximum time steps is 400.

name: fa
description: Peak-to-average power ratio for cosine-type axial power distribution (=1.0, unless iq = 1; see description of iq).

name: ifixedtsurf
description: Indicator for using axial temperature distribution 0 = Cladding temperature will be calculated based on input power and coolant conditions. 1 = Cladding temperature will be specified by the user for certain time steps.  Each time step where the temperature will be set by the user, the input variable, go, should be set equal to 0.0.

name: xt
description: The elevations in each cladt, xt array defining a cladding temperature profile. Note the first value should be 0.0 and the last value must =totl. Begin the input elevations for the second temperature profile at xt(n+1) where n is the number of values in the first profile. Defined as xt(N), where N = Axial Node Index for Input Temperature Profile.

name: cladt
description: The cladding surface temperature xt(N) elevation for the M-th temperature profile.  The number of cladt, xt pairs for the Mth power shape is defined by jnsurftemp(M). Defined as cladt(N), where N = Axial Node Index for Input Temperature Profile, M = Surface Temperature Profile Number.
limitations: Default = 0.0. Maximum number of cladt,xt pairs is 40.

name: jnsurftemp
description: The number of cladt, xt value pairs for each axial temperature distribution; Input in the same sequence as the cladt and xt arrays. Defined as jnsurftemp(M), where M = Surface Temperature Profile Number.
limitations: Default = 0. Maximum number of shapes is 20. Maximum number of cladt,xt pairs is 40.

name: jstsurftemp
description: The sequential number of the temperature profile to be used for each time step. One value of jstsurftemp is required per time step if ifixedtsurf = 1. Defined as jstsurftemp(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.
limitations: Default = 0. Maximum number of shapes = 20. Maximum time steps is 400.

name: nr
description: Number of radial boundaries in the pellet (for temperature calculations and temperature distribution output). These are spaced by the code with greater fraction in the outer region to optimize definition of the heat generation radial distribution.
limitations: Greater than 1, less than 25; suggested minimum number is 17. Default = 17

name: ngasr
description: Number of equal-volume radial rings in the pellet for gas release calculations.
limitations: Greater than 6, less than 50; suggested number is 45. Default = 45

name: ngasmod
description: Flag to select fission gas release model. ngasmod=1 selects ANS5.4 model, ngasmod=2 selects Massih model, ngasmod=3 selects FRAPFGR model

name: na
description: Number of equal-length axial regions along the rod, for which calculations are performed and output

name: nunits
description: Signal for units system to be used for input and output: 1 = British units, 0 = SI units. Note that input of nunits >10 will activate 'debug' output, which is significant in volume.

name: crephr
description: Subdivision for internal creep steps. Should be set to a minimum of 10 creep steps per time step.

name: sgapf
description: Number of fission gas atoms formed per 100 fissions.

name: slim
description: Limit on swelling.

name: qend
description: Fraction of end-node heat that transfers to the plenum gas.

name: igas
description: Time step to begin calculation of fission gas release. For all time steps prior to igas, the calculated gas release will not be included in the gas in the rod void volume. (Note: this option only is available when using the Massih fission gas release model.)

name: mechan
description: Option to select mechanical model mechan=1 selects FEA model mechan=2 selects FRACAS-I model

name: nce
description: Number of radial elements in the cladding for FEA model

name: frcoef
description: Coulomb friction coefficient between the cladding and the fuel pellet.

name: igascal
description: Internal pressure calculation for FEA model: 1 = normal pressure calculation, 0 = use prescribed pressure set by p1.

name: p1
description: Rod internal pressure for each time step for FEA model. Needed only if igascal = 0. Defined as p1(IT), where IT = Time Step Index.

name: sigftc
description: Bias on fuel thermal conductivity model. sigftc = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigftc = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.
limitations: sigftc = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigftc = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ. Default = 0

name: sigftex
description: Bias on fuel thermal expansion model. sigftex = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigftex = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: sigfgr
description: Bias on fission gas release model. sigfgr = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigfgr = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: sigswell
description: Bias on fuel swelling model. sigswell = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigswell = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: sigcreep
description: Bias on cladding creep model. sigcreep = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigcreep = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: siggro
description: Bias on cladding axial growth model. siggro = 1 biases model up 1σ, siggro = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: sigcor
description: Bias on cladding corrosion model. sigcor = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigcor = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: sigh2
description: Bias on cladding hydrogen pickup model. sigh2 = 1 biases model up 1σ, sigh2 = -1.5 biases model down 1.5σ.

name: imswch
description: Signal for EM models: 1 = All EM models, 0 = No EM models, -1 = Selected EM models (input signals in $EMFPCN).

name: impowr
description: EM Power requirement index; impowr = 0 not assumed to be required

name: imfuel
description: Switch on dimensional changes: imfuel = 0 BE changes, imfuel = 1 EM changes

name: imdens
description: Switch on densification model

name: imrelo
description: Switch on fuel relocation model

name: imclad
description: Switch on cladding deformation; imclad= 1 no permanent deformation

name: imgapc
description: Switch on gap conductance calculation

name: imenrg
description: Switch on stored energy reference temperature: imenrg = 0 for 298 K, imenrg = 1 for 273 K

name: jdlpr
description: Output print control for each time step: 0 = All axial nodes, 1 = peak-power axial node, -1 = axial summary for NO printout each step, see 'nopt'.
limitations: Default = 1. Note: The code sets jdlpr to 0 (full output) when ntape is greater than 0, to assure full axial array of permanent radial deformations is passed to FRAPTRAN.

name: nopt
description: Control on printout. 0 = printout each time step (controlled by jdlpr), 1 = Case input and summary sheet only.

name: nplot
description: Control on output of plot file for excel plotting routine. 0 = No output plot file will be created, 1 = Plot output file will be created (File 66).  Note: The name of the plot file should be specified in the input file below where the name of the ordinary output (File 06) is specified.

name: ntape
description: Signal for creating a start tape for FRAPTRAN, from subroutine RESTFS.  If ntape > 0, RESTFS is called and a tape (file 22='restart') is incrementally written each time step.

name: nread
description: Signal to start up from a restart tape (File 13). The value of nread is the time step to start from. Note: User must switch the restart-write tape file number from 12 to 13 to make it a restart-read tape. Note that the restart tape does not currently contain complete restart information for the fission gas release models.

name: nrestr
description: Signal for writing a restart tape for FRAPCON-3. If nrestr ≠ 0, subroutine TAPEGEN generates a restart tape (file 12) at each time step. Note that the restart tape does not currently contain complete restart information for the fission gas release models.
